message:
Add copy/cut/paste prevention to the word field in all games

Although most games filter out various forbidden characters, this is
done using the "keydown" event, which means that characters entered
by pasting are not filtered. To solve this problem, a function has been
added to MG_GAME_API (preventEvents()) which can be used to prevent
pasting, copying, etc. In addition, calls to this function have been
added to each individual game.

Fix GuessWhat to prevent multiword hint exploit

easier for users to enter multiword hints. This has been fixed using
the same code that ZenTag uses, with some slight modifications. This
limits the characters that can be entered in the text area to just
letters (a-z, A-Z).

title: Modify tag parsing to split multiword tags properly
message:
Modify tag parsing to split multiword tags properly

Multiword tags are split to create additional single-word tags. These
single-word tags are only saved in the database - they are not returned
to the user and do not affect their score.

When tags are submitted from a game, they are expected to either be an
array of tags, or a string separated by commas or double quotes (").
The two symbols are treated equivalently, so matching quotes is not
necessary.

Known issues:
 - GuessWhat does not have client-side character filtering, making it
   possible to give multiword hints. This bug is more evident with the
   changes to tag parsing. It should be easily solvable using a list
   of forbidden characters like ZenTag or StupidRobot.

title: Analytics: Fix event logs being cut off in POST requests
message:
Analytics: Fix event logs being cut off in POST requests

The PHP setting max_input_vars limits the number of variables in a POST
request (default value is 1000). As a result, longer event logs were being cut
off after 1000 attributes were stored (timestamps, actions, etc).

To solve the problem, the event log is now encoded as a JSON string (i.e: a
single variable) before sending it in a POST request to the server. The server
decodes it, parses the needed information, and saves it in a file.

title: StupidRobot: Update custom fonts
message:
StupidRobot: Update custom fonts

Previously, the custom fonts were such that they had different heights in
Windows vs. Mac operating systems. This caused the display to be distorted in
Windows.

The fonts were updated by retrieving the original .otf font files, and using
the FontSquirrel webfont generator to create the other formats (.eot, .ttf,
.woff, and .svg) and generate a compatible CSS @font-face specification.

The FontSquirrel generator can be found here:
www.fontsquirrel.com/tools/webfont-generator

Other changes:
 - Modify timer margin to realign game elements after font fix

title: StupidRobot: Fix flashMessage overwriting final screen
message:
StupidRobot: Fix flashMessage overwriting final screen

The flashMessage function is used to display StupidRobot's response to a user
submission, first showing the response, then restoring the text to its
original prompt ("Human: what is in this image?"). However, if it was called
and then the final screen was immediately shown (either by time limit or by
clicking the "Quit" button), then it would overwrite the final response ("I
now comprehend X more words...") with the original prompt.

This was due to an HTML element ID conflict between the in-game and final
screen messages. The latter's ID has been changed from "gameMessage" to
"endgameMessage", resolving the issue.

title: StupidRobot: Add in-game score display to final screen
message:
StupidRobot: Add in-game score display to final screen
Adds an in-game score display to accompany the StupidRobot scoring algorithm.
Note that the two are completely independent - while it is possible to falsify
the in-game display, it will not affect the overall scoreboard.

As a part of adding the score display, the HTML structure of the final screen
has been redone, removing the questionable use of <span> elements and
line breaks, and replacing them with a table. This also allows for easy
alignment of the score counters with their respective words. In addition, the
empty 11- to 13-letter word spaces remaining from an earlier revision have now
been removed entirely.

Aesthetic changes will likely be made to the display before merging this branch
back into the development branch, but the functionality is finished. In
addition, there is a known bug where the display will sometimes not animate;
this is an inconsistent problem and the cause is not yet known.

title: Improve displaySession parser, add new StupidRobot events
message:
Improve displaySession parser, add new StupidRobot events

These changes reflect feedback on the original displaySession parser. The actor
for each event (player/game) has been capitalized for emphasis. Repeats of the
image being displayed have been removed. In addition, two additional event
types have been added to the log: "start session" and "end game". The first is
logged when the game starts, and the second when the score screen is displayed.

title: Add parsing for analytics data
message:
Add parsing for analytics data

The parsers for StupidRobot analytics are based on the Tetris parsers; the two
use the same framework. Currently, there are two StupidRobot parsers written:
 - displaySession:  displays a log of the game session
    - (StupidRobot specific)
    - concatenates letters
    - displays image thumbnails
 - exportCSV: exports events as CSV without processing

title: StupidRobot: Add magnifying glass to image
message:
StupidRobot: Add magnifying glass to image
A magnifying glass icon is now displayed in the upper left corner of the image
to indicate that the image can be zoomed. Because each image can be a different
size, the icon is positioned dynamically. Functionally, clicking on the icon is
no different than clicking anywhere else on the image, although the icon
highlights yellow when moused over.

The code where both image and icon positioning happens should be refactored in
a separate commit, as it makes multiple identical calls to the jQuery selector.

title: StupidRobot: Fix cut to end-screen after 7 words, re_init word limit
message:
StupidRobot: Fix cut to end-screen after 7 words, re_init word limit

This commit fixes the StupidRobot code intended to cut to the end-screen early
if the player enters seven accepted words. Previously, if the user entered all
seven words, they would have to wait for the timer to run out or click "Quit"
to continue.

Specifically, it fixes a conditional (acceptedWords > maxLevel) to be
(acceptedWords > maxLevel - 4) because the user cannot enter 1, 2, or 3-letter
words.

Other changes:
 - Changed definition of maxLevel in re_init to 10.
   The re_init function is intended to reset various game constants to their
   initial values. However, the maxLevel in re_init was not changed from 13 to
   10 when the original constant was. This meant that in subsequent games,
   players could type longer words, although they would not be accepted.
   (This also caused problems with the conditional mentioned above.)

title: Add JSON formatting for analytics to improve human-readability
message:
Add JSON formatting for analytics to improve human-readability
The analytics for StupidRobot exports event logs as JSON files. This commit
adds whitespace to the encoded JSON data before exporting it, making the files
accessible to people as well as other programs.

The JSONFormat class extends the existing CJSON class with formatting
capabilities. It implements the JSON formatter used in Chris Dary's JSON linter
(http://github.com/arc90/jsonlintdotcom), which is under the MIT License.

Other changes:
 - Remove duplicate code in mg.game.api.js (sendLog now calls logEvent to log
   the "close window" event).

title: Add scoring for StupidRobot
message:
Add scoring for StupidRobot
Adds scoring to StupidRobot with a simple formula. In addition, this commit
creates a new reset action for the GamesController which saves the score to the
database (UserToGame). After saving, it resets the game engine and starts a new
played game session.

The scoring algorithm awards N points for each accepted tag, where N is the
length of the word. Thus, the maximum points possible per round is 49.

Known issues:
 - Because the reset action creates a new PlayedGame entry, it ends up adding
   one empty entry to the database per window session.

used to distinguish multiple logs created at the same time.
Example of a filename: 2014-07-14.185919.001.json

title: Add separate controller action for saving event logs
message:
Add separate controller action for saving event logs
Previously, logs were saved by sending a POST request to the existing play
action of the GamesController, which rerouted them to the proper function. This
commit adds a separate saveLog action to the GamesController, and sends the
POST requests to that action instead.

Note: actions are functions registered with a controller, which can be accessed
via a URL. For more info, look at the Yii documentation.

Other changes:
 - Store logs in game-specific folders within the analytics folder
   - e.g: StupidRobot logs will be stored in a separate folder than ZenTag logs
   - Note that only StupidRobot has event-logging currently

title: STUPIDROBOT - Add logging for non-player events, other minor changes
message:
STUPIDROBOT - Add logging for non-player events, other minor changes
This commit refines the event-logging introduced previously. Primarily, it adds
logging for non-player events in StupidRobot, including the image displayed and
the game's reactions to tag submissions. It also makes some other minor
changes:
 - add browser details to event log
 - add actor to event (either player or game)
 - change details of keypress from key code to character
    - add helper function to determine character using KeyboardEvent
 - move logEvent and sendLog functions out of StupidRobot to Game API
    - This will allow the functions to be used by other games in the future

Notes about getPrintableKey helper function: the W3C specifications for the
KeyboardEvent event include a "key" property that contains the key value.
However, as this is not actually supported by many popular browsers, the helper
function uses the keyCode and shiftKey properties to determine the key value.

title: STUPIDROBOT: Add logging of player events for analysis
message:
STUPIDROBOT: Add logging of player events for analysis
This commit introduces basic event-logging to allow developers to analyze
gameplay and make changes accordingly. Currently, it is only active for
StupidRobot, where it records keystrokes within the textbox and clicks on
functional buttons. When the player leaves the page, the log is stored as a
JSON text file on the server.

title: ==== 1. ACCURACY BONUS ====
message:
==== 1. ACCURACY BONUS ====

If word exists in database for image:
* run ACCURACY BONUS algorithm:

C = chance that accuracy bonus will be given if player's tag matches what is in the database
N = # of tags in database for media item

C = ( 100 / √N ) + 30

Cmax = 100 (if C > 100, then set C = 100)
Cmin = 30 (if C < 30, then set C = 30)

Generate a random number
If random-number < C, give Accuracy Bonus (depending on Round)
Else +1 point

== Round / Accuracy Bonus ==
Round 1 = +3 points
Round 2 = +5 points
Round 3 = +7 points

* ACCURACY BONUS is given only ONCE per round

title: MDG-95,MDG-78
message:
MDG-95,MDG-78
-- ROLES ---
players, institution, researcher, gameadmin

players
* profile includes player supplied info + media they've "liked" + playlist of institutions
* profile is GAME SPECIFIC = player only sees information specific to game.

 gameadmin / institutions / researchers

* separate login page (Game Server Login page; each game will have their own login page)

institution
* during MG Content Installation,
** Register Institution Content Server with Game Server -- for Game API (non-user account; server only)
** Create a user-account on Game Server
** On Game Server, Gameadmin will give Institution-role access
* can only view things that are institution specific
* can only export tag data that is specific to institution's collections

researcher
* ability to view all tags, collections, games, player data
* cannot export data

gameadmin
* access to all pages
* can export all data (tag, game, player, etc.)

title: ZenTag: Add code to implement PASS button
message:
ZenTag: Add code to implement PASS button

This commit adds code to implement the PASS button for Zen Tag.

The basic idea is that when the user clicks the PASS button, we send
"__PASSONTHISTURN__" as the tag. The internals of the tag backend (in
MGTags.php) clean that up to "PASSONTHISTURN" when we handle it in
other code, though -- so be wary of that.

This commit implements the little pieces necessary to ignore this tag
in scoring, when selecting tags for single-player GuessWhat, etc. The
tag does show up in the backend when selecting all tags, but as that's
just the ADMIN interface, it's fine for it to be visible there.

title: Guess What: Clean up evaluateGuess; fix calls to areHintsAllowedLeft()
message:
Guess What: Clean up evaluateGuess; fix calls to areHintsAllowedLeft()

This commit cleans up some of the code in evaluateGuess to make it
more readable, and fixes some calls to areHintsAllowedLeft() so that
the function is properly called.

The behavior of the code seems to be correct from the standpoint of
the 'guesser', however even after we've run out of hints there's still
a message propagating back to the 'describer' that is triggering the
event for initiating the hint-giving mode. That message chain might be
important for updating the display of the 'describer' to let them know
that the 'guesser' is continuing to interact with the game (through
guesses), however we need to nip at least part of it in the bud to
prevent extra hints (and their fun but annoying negative-numbered
indicies!).

Export: Fix non-static function calls

This commit fixes some function calls to methods on XMPAppend. We
instatiate an instance of XMPAppend so that we can make calls
dynamically instead of statically.

At the heart of it, none of these functions carry state; it would make
some sense to just refactor XMPAppend (and the libraries below it) so
that we could make all of our calls statically, however because this
refactoring might reach down deeper than the XMPAppend layer, this
would take a bit of time and would make it harder to upgrade the PHP

title: PHP Metadata Toolkit: Fix return value to be a pointer
message:
PHP Metadata Toolkit: Fix return value to be a pointer

This commit fixes a bug in the PHP Metadata Toolkit code in XMPAppend
where the return value from function find_XMP_block was sometimes
'FALSE' even though the return type on the function was specified as
being a reference.

Two notes:

1) PHP should have better error handling and reporting so that it
would be more clear that the return types didn't match up.

2) This code comes directly from the PHP Metadata Toolkit library, so
we should be careful and potentially write some more (Unit) tests to
make sure that we've covered various code paths here and don't run
into similar problems again.

title: PHP Metadata Toolkit: Make several tweaks to get XMP to append properly
message:
PHP Metadata Toolkit: Make several tweaks to get XMP to append properly

This commit makes several tweaks to the pieces of the XMPAppend class
to make the code properly operate on an image and append new metadata
to the 'dc:description' field.

Several of these changes are temporary and are marked as such -- we'd
like to further understand the details of why these tweaks are
necessary before we make them wholly a part of the library.

In particular, I'm curious about the bits of the template XMP array
that were preventing the XMP data from being recognized by external
programs. I need to ask Evan Hunter (the original author of the code)
about that particular structure.
